channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Volkswagen, Germany’s largest private employer, could cut over 15,000 jobs with plant closures—and there’s no plan B, Jefferies says
item.description: Jefferies analyst said that Volkswagen's unions "can only strike on pay, not plant closure or layoffs if the latter are not contractually protected.”

item.title: Asian stocks mixed Tuesday as Fed bankers convene for interest-rate decision
China controls 70% of the world’s critical rare earth minerals. Finding an alternative is proving tough—and expensive
item.description: The U.S. and its allies are trying to find new sources of rare earth metals, used in phones and fighter jets, outside of China.

item.title: Details in short supply as Trump launches his family cryptocurrency project
Almost a century after Virginia Woolf’s ‘A Room of One’s Own’ essay, women are driving the housing market
item.description: Woolf would be pleasantly surprised that today, women having a whole house of their own is not only commonplace but a key driver of the housing market...

item.title: Why Intel’s latest move for its foundry business is so significant
Pizza Hut will put your résumé on a pizza box to help you get a job
item.description: That’s one way to stand out.

item.title: How Microsoft’s dividend hike and new $60 billion stock-buyback program stack up
Massive Houston pipeline fire was caused by an SUV that struck a natural gas valve and was incinerated
item.description: Deer Park officials said police and local FBI agents initiated investigations and found no preliminary reports that would suggest a coordinated or “te...

item.title: Intel’s stock could post biggest two-day gain in 22 years on upbeat foundry news
